alert.note: Alert for Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 12:10PM MDT until May 06 at 12:37PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... Elk River at Milner affecting Routt County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elk River at Milner. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Lower portions of 42 road near the Elk River bridge are starting to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Routt County Road 44 is closed between Highway 40 and Routt County Road 42 due to flooding. No estimated time of reopening. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 7.6 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.7 feet on 05/30/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
